Lack enough support: The claim lacks support as there is no Article III, Section IV in the United States Constitution.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that there is a provision in the Constitution that prohibits a "lame duck" candidate from seeking to fill a Supreme Court vacancy, which is a problematic assumption because no such provision exists.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no Article III, Section IV in the Constitution.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the significance of the alleged provision by attributing it to the Founding Fathers and suggesting it is a constitutional mandate.
Falters at times: The claim falters as it relies on misinformation and false information about the Constitution.
